If this was just a standard swinging doujin with people having mindless sex, it would be whatever, but what pisses me off is how the author tries incredibly hard to get under the reader's skin. It's obnoxious and edgy. I always try to separate the work from the author and assume that fiction doesn't have to represent the creator's real life values, but it's hard to do that on this one. You're drawing porn in your moldy single-room Japanese apartment while eating old cup noodles, my guy. Get off your high horse. On the bright side, most women IRL don't behave like this. Cuckboi could just move on and find a nice woman whose values align with his, but he's not a character, and his sole purpose is firing shots at more conservative people. If the author wants to be realistic, then let's be realistic: This shit is unhealthy and bound to create mixed feelings, maybe even an unwanted pregnancy. Then the girls get dumped because they were never loved in the first place. There's your realism.

I hate it when hentai gets preachy like this. The first part was alright. It showed that MC was being a huge incel by making stupid assumptions while the two couples were just having some harmless fun at the water park, as couples do. Then comes the last few pages where Asahi acts like an actual slut in the face of a valid point about the whole swapping thing. She calls it "reprehensible" but she sure as hell never shows any remorse over it. The guys also suck. At first I thought they actually cared about the girls, but their feelings are completely shallow and superficial (if those feelings even exist in the first place). They don't even think once before handing their girlfriends to someone else as long as they get some pussy in the process. It look less like a relationship and more like an orgy between fuck buddies at a frat house.
@Rajumbal Again, another idiot who don't know what netorare means. Netorare does not equal to cheating and cuckold. Netorare means getting stolen. Why are so many retards on this site??

There are other stories like this on this site, but this particular one is a notch ahead. The key difference is the straight laced girl. Her fall is done in a much more realistic way. She gets swept up by events and does things she knows are extremely wrong, but she likes enough of it that she stays. She is convinced she can have her cake and eat it to, but we all know that it won't end well. She'll eventually learn that she's not as valuable to her boyfriend as she thinks she is, and she'll struggle to have a normal and healthy relationship.

The bright side is the MC dodged a bullet. That girl would have fallen eventually. If not now then at college. When she encounters someone who is truly concerned for her well-being, she pushes him away even though she knows there is a problem.

The NTR comes from the author's intention to make readers feel a relatable sense of indignation for the beta MC for missing out. It has nothing to do with whether or not characters are in a relationship. Broken up couples are just a common scenario in NTR because it matches that intention.

It's called BSS NTR (Boku ga Saki ni Suki datta no ni), a subgenre where the heroine/s who aren't in a relationship with the MC, ends up with a someone else. A lot of netorare doujinshi are written this way, so they are appropriately tagged as NTR. There doesn't need to be a couple in a relationship for a doujinshi to be considered NTR.

Also, all he cares about is having sex (which may be because of his time as a young teen and the whole fucking concept of this doujin). If I have a chance to make a fan sequel of this (not just oneshot but more of a series that talks about MC overcoming his past demons which  includes his relationship with the two girls and his sibling) then I would fucking do it..
